ygData.subject: RE: Lava & Corpses  was  Bard Handicap of Sorts
ygData.msgSnippet: I ve recovered 6 or 7 corpses from the lava in Sol A (so far none of them mine :-)).  In each case, I simply locate with my song, get a levitation and then
ygData.messageBody:
I've recovered 6 or 7 corpses from the lava in Sol A (so far none of them
mine :-)). In each case, I simply locate with my song, get a levitation and
then just bounce out over the lava and back to safety before I have the
chance to float down. In every case, I've been able to /corpse the body
back (through the Z axis bug?) without any problems... Even the ones where
people panic and tried to swim for it (my wife tried to climb the
waterfall).


Taneran Dreamweaver
<Clan Jax>
Bard of the 30th song
Prexus

> -----Original Message-----
> From: kim@... [mailto:kim@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, December 07, 1999 1:16 PM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Lava & Corpses was Bard Handicap of Sorts
>
>
> From: <kim@...>
>
> On Tue, 7 Dec 1999, James Schuldes wrote:
> >
> > I died in the lava - fell off the ramp running to zone on first visit to
> > that place. My wiz fiend levi'd over and dragged it out - I
> was rezzed and
> > looted it at the zone - but boy was I nervous while sitting in Rivervale
> > waiting for them to get it. She musta blindly clicked until she got it
> > targeted. I consented and she dragged. She might have pulled
> it to a place
> > where Z-axis effect can pull it up to the top, zoned out, then
> /corpsed it
> > up to the top. (We /corpsed one from the bottom of HH canyon
> straight up to
> > the top ledge one time.)
>
> You can drag stuff out of lava anywhere else in Sol A (you may
> have to get creative with your levitate, but you can do it).
> It's just the section past that lavafall where you can't pull
> it out.
>
> > p.s. some one mentioned that you can zone out from the lava
> pool into Sol-b?
> > Does that mean that if you were to zone from sol-b you would
> end up in Lava
> > if you were not levi'd when you zoned? Like someone could zone
> out of sol-b
> > in panic and die in the lava?
>
> That particular zone point goes from lava to lava. I spent
> the better part of an hour (my first hour ever in Sol B mind
> you) finding a friend's corpse after he fell in in Sol A,
> zoned through to Sol B, and died. We had no idea where in
> that lava zone came out in Sol B, and I had to rely on the
> song to figure out where his corpse was. (I was not attacked
> the entire time, and figured Sol B wasn't so bad so decided to
> play there a bit, and problem died to a sonic bat train. :-)
>
> --
> John H. Kim
> kim@...
>
> > Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to
> lol@... with the subject submissions.
>
